comments.body:
Hey there, thanks for sharing your suggestion.
This topic has come up in the past and unfortunately patched clients is not something we can easily support. The app needs to map the mods from the game to the trade website. Given there is no Chinese on the international trade website, this mapping relies on 
https://web.poe.garena.tw/
 and the app redirects all queries to there as well.
A possible solution would be to force use the international website with the 
garena.tw
 mappings, but this comes with quite some drawbacks like the market would be in english, mappings could be wrong etc.
For now we think the amount of users affected by this is too slim to justify implementing a custom solution. If we later have some more time to spare or this topic gets more popular we will re-evaluated this decision.

Has been partially added with 1.7.0 üéâ We'll improve on this feature in a future iteration. 
Note: Needs to be enabled by going to preferences > context > Use international trade website.

cleu8knyw02ogoj20u6d9hqd1.title: Some stat search ideas
cleu8knyw02ogoj20u6d9hqd1.body:
Preface: I am not a professional programmer so I can not speak to the ease with which these can be accomplished. These are functions I would like to have available, but I do understand that they may be difficult or maybe even impossible to do. Regardless, I wanted to share them for your consideration just in case.

Generalized stat searches - Say I want all rings that impact chaos in any ways, regardless of resistance, damage, penetration.. I don't know exactly what mods are available and so I was to browse an overview of items with that particular keywords.

Item Type and Item Name grouping - 

Perhaps I am interested in the items that provide the most Increased Item Quantity. This often returns many results of the same item making it difficult to get an idea of what alternatives may be available. If instead, all items named "Goldrim" were nested in a collapsible manner then I could see the next best option for the price, ect. Different types of filters for collapsing would be nice too.

Item Base exclusion

Or in general any sort of exclusion options would be good here. We can exclude stats using the NOT stat filters at the moment but say I wanted to search all amulets for IIR but didn't want to see and Gold Amulet results. This would address that use case.

cleu89p6e02oeoj20yw9lefzf.title: Drag and drop stat filters
cleu89p6e02oeoj20yw9lefzf.body:
I would like to be able to drag a stat from market results into the stat filters. I think this would be especially useful when trying to search for terms that have multiple implementations with the same name (This can require adding many of the same filter line trying to find the one that's valid for your particular item type. Pseudo does not work in all cases.)

Another example from the above image would being able to drag and drop the implicit. While pseudo should cover this particular implicit, that is not always the case.

cleu80bib02ocoj20g9yq8nl3.title: Market Overlay - Nested Folders with drag and drop feature.
cleu80bib02ocoj20g9yq8nl3.body: I would like to be able to nest my saved searches into folder with the ability to drag and drop searches and folders into and out of folders. Just like a typical folder system.

clepw4nx201l4oj20kf8ycuvl.title: Give market overlay priority over evaluate overlay when searching.
clepw4nx201l4oj20kf8ycuvl.body:
Something I do often is find a currency or item I want to look up in the larger market tab usually accessed with alt+m.

To do this I press alt+d on the item then use the top left button[Open in market] next to the setting icon in the evaluate overlay window that appears and that opens up the market overlay. 

Once I have the market overlay open I will typically make some changes to my search parameters such as deslecting divs, or changing stock for bulk exchanges or altering stats filters. (Ideally I'd be able to set some defaults for these in the preferences, though I may have just missed the option.)

Once I have made my changes I will press the search button in the market overlay. Doing that only refreshes the evaluate overlay with the results unless I close that overlay.

I would like it if my search results appeared in the market overlay once it is open.
